headline: Apple Harvest Pound Cake with Caramel Glaze
description: Apples and walnuts are folded into a cinnamon-spiced cake. This is a fantastic Bundt cake that my grandmother used to make for Thanksgiving. It has been a family favorite for years!

video.description: Celebrate Fall with a beautiful bundt!
video.name: Apple Harvest Pound Cake with Caramel Glaze

name: Apple Harvest Pound Cake with Caramel Glaze
recipeIngredient: 2 medium Granny Smith apples - peeled, cored and chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 inch Bundt pan.

In a large bowl, beat the sugar, oil, vanilla and eggs with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Combine the flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt; stir into the batter just until blended. Fold in the apples and walnuts using a spoon. Pour into the prepared pan.
Bake for 1 hour and 20 minutes in the preheated oven, until a toothpick inserted into the crown or the cake comes out clean. Allow to cool for about 20 minutes then invert on to a wire rack.

Make the glaze by heating the butter, milk and brown sugar in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve the sugar, then remove from the heat. Drizzle over the warm cake. I like to place a sheet of aluminum foil under the cooling rack to catch the drips for easy clean up.

review.reviewBody: The cake is perfect, but, the glaze looked good when put on the cake but when hardened it turned grainy. This is twice I made it and the same results.

I made this cake after a neighbor brought it to my mom. My parents loved it SO much they got the recipe from her and shared it with me. Now I've made it twice and we all LOVE it! So easy and delicious! I went a little crazy and used 3 teaspoons of cinnamon, added three shakes of ground cloves and a pinch or two of nutmeg. This recipe has such great bones. No, it's NOT too much oil so don't let other reviewers fool you. I used Canola Oil and the amount was perfect. I'll bet they just forgot some of the flour. It happens... The batter is a thick batter so don't worry about that. The cake itself is not too dense and perfectly moist. The nuts end up tasting like candied nuts... Amazing!!! Also, I used pecans instead of walnuts. Just a taste preference... You should definitely make this cake!!! By the way, it is annoying to me too, when people entirely change a recipe and then rate it. I simply added more spices and swapped out the nuts. I did not mess with the amounts of flour, sugar, eggs or oil. Sometimes I think recipe makers cut down on the amount of spices because long ingredient lists can intimidate people. Definitely save this recipe and make it for tonight! You won't regret it!

This recipe is a winner at our house. Guests are often hoping that I have baked it for their visit! Also, it is incredibly easy to make. I am completely blind and I have no trouble following the directions. My husband likes to make the glaze and he uses bourbon instead of water.
I love this recipe it is so easy and everyone in my family just loves it. I make it through out the fall and winter months.
I couldn't get out of the pan but that was my fault.
This wasn’t that good. I wouldn’t put the salt next time and I would add more sugar. It just wasn’t sweet enough for me. Really disappointed since most reviews were good.
Delicious. Easy to make, smells heavenly while baking and tastes as good as it smells. Used Gala apples. Next time I will chop the nuts smaller, but that is all I would change.
Whoa! This was a tremendous find. It was outstanding. Very lucky find.

I thought an hour and twenty minutes was a bit pong at that temp, and I was right. Mine was over cooked at one hour. Outer was dark brown. Was still moist inside. Glaze was good but I didn’t boil it long enough to melt all the sugar. Cake was okay but nothing remarkable. Probably won’t make it again
Made this countless times, only change was using butter instead of oil and also used 3 Granny Smith apples. Great recipe.
I added 1/2 teaspoon of nutmeg and completely left out the nuts. I also used cake flower instead which made it so much softer.
This cake is wonderful. I used 1 cup oil and 1/2 cup applesauce. It turned out great. Will make this again.
This was very delicious and moist! For a finer texture, I grated the apples instead of chopping them.

Unfortunately I listened to the reviews about changing the ingredients. I used 1 cup oil and 1/2cup applesauce, 1 cup brown and 1 cup white sugar. Also cooked it at 
325 for 70 minutes. The cake is way too dense and not moist at all. I'm an experienced baker and know how to mix cakes. I will try it again without changing any of the ingredients. I should know better.
Fantastic cake, but I followed suggestions to cut down the oil and only used 1 cup instead of 1 1/2 - it was still very moist, so stick with 1 cup.

My boyfriend loved it. I didn't have enough green apples, so I used one Granny smith and one jazz apple. I used 1 1/14 cup of canola oil after reading reviews. The batter does get SUPER thick before you put it in the pan, which I was concerned about but it didn't seem to matter. I baked it for 70 minutes @ 350 which was perfect. It was cooked but the middle was moist for sure while the outside was harder. I'd make this again with the applesauce substitutions just to see how it is.
The whole family of 6 loved it. I altered nothing except cooking at 325 for 70 min.
Everyone loved this cake, it was delicious! This is my go to cake recipe and you don’t have to wait until fall to make it. I’ve made it at least 4 times now
I followed the advice and reduced the cooking time. My glaze didn't really turn out but that was a 'me' problem
I was so embarrassed when I took this to my office potluck. It was dry and crumbled not sliced. I've re-read the directions and can't see where I went wrong. To be fair, I'll try it once more.

I think this is the first review i’m leaving...this cake is DELICIOUS! My boyfriend loves it. Very flavorful. I read the reviews and also used brown and white sugar. I’d like to make it again using applesauce.
Other than 1/2 each white/brown sugar, followed recipe. Delicious!
I made it as a pound cake first, then as oversized (think Costco) muffins. Very easy recipe and very delicious. It'll stay in my recipe box for years to come.
Made this for Christmas and the family loved it!

Delicious...everyone loved it. I also cooked 70 minutes at 325 degrees, and doubled cinnamon. Let the glaze cool a bit and thicken before spooning or pouring it. I topped with chopped pecans, which looked nice.

Most awesome ever. I'm an old Vermonter looking for something like this for awhile now. I did not make the topping because we feel it would be too sweet. I also split the nuts between walnuts , roasted sunflower,and pumpkin seeds. Apples and pears 50/50. I bet a scouche of bourbon did not hut it either! as As Mr Welk used to say Wunnerful, Wunnerful, Wunnerful.
So easy to make and so easy to enjoy! I served the warm cake with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, and it was a hit!

I made this for Thanksgiving dessert. Friends and family raved about it. I used some of the suggested changes; 1 cup granulated sugar and 1 cup light brown sugar, reduced the oil to 1 cup and added 1/2 cup applesauce, and I baked it at 325 for 70 minutes. It was wonderful and I'll definitely make it again.

Look this cake made just right is indescribable! Heat it up the flavor is just in the woods,crisp cool winter day,cup of coffee drinking kinda nostalgia! It was fun to make and great to eat! Definitely making this one over and over. This is my show out cake it's just that good.

I made the cake twice, for thanksgiving. On One I added chest nuts and on the second some cranberry. Didn't get a chance to get a picture. But it came out awesome. The only thing, I had to add like 1/4 of milk. Batter to thick.
For those complaining about the amount of oil, you can do what I did and replace the oil with cinnamon applesauce! Same amount. It came out perfect! Loved it!!! Easy to make!
I made it by the recipe exactly and it was a super big hit at Thanksgiving. A great big thumbs up
I will add more Apple.
Awesome recipe. Didn't last an hour after served. Glaze is wonderful.
Turn out really good. The family loved it!!

I was looking for a recipe to make in my mini harvest bundt pans and this was perfect! The only change I made was reduced the sugar to 1 & 1/2 cups because I don’t like things super sweet. With the caramel glaze this was just the right amount for me. It turned out a bit crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. I’m adding it to my harvest recipe collection!
I didn't change anything except removing the nuts (my son is allergice) and my family thought it was delicious.
Definitely needs less oil. I'd probably add more apples. The Carmel sauce was just heavenly.

I cut down the butter with applesauce, used 1 cup of regular sugar and brown sugar and floured the apples before adding to the dough. This recipe makes a huge cake and I thought it came out a little dry and more of the consistency of a bread cake. We enjoyed it but it made way to much cake for 2 people to eat.

This cake is fantastic! I took this cake to work and it got compliments from everyone. I did make some changes based on another reviewer that worked out really well. I increased the cinnamon to 1 tspn, used half white and half brown sugar in the cake, and subbed 1/2 cup of the oil for apple sauce.
Made no changes it was excellent. Couldn't keep the family away from it.
Took this cake to a church function. It was gone in a minute. I was asked to make it again. Very attractive to the eye, and good on the pallet. Thank you for such an awesome recipe.
My family loved this cake. I changed the recipe in that I did not use any nuts and substituted Apple Cider and made a glaze. I can not show you a picture because there's nothing left but the plate.

I did not have a Bundt pan so just put it in a 9 x 13 and it tasted wonderful. My grand kids loved it. I would like to try to make it lower calorie and lower sugar if possible. I will make this again.

Made it almost as described however when I was about to make it, I realized I had no walnuts but had slivered almonds instead. My oven was preheated to 350 for the cake anyway so I popped the almonds in for 5 minutes to toast them, and used them instead of walnuts. The cake was excellent, moist and light and everyone loved it. Recipe is a keeper!

I didn't adjust the oil and didn't think it was too 'wet' at all. I DID adjust the baking temp and time (I think my oven runs a little hot) to the suggested 325 degrees for 70 minutes. I added a bit of nutmeg, just because I love nutmeg. I thought the glaze was a bit too thin after making so beat it with a wooden spoon for a few minutes until it started to thicken. Turned out amazing!

The only changes I made was that I substituted 1 cup of pecan pieces for the walnuts as my husband does not like walnuts. I also used 2 teaspoons of half and half cream instead of milk for the glaze. It was so yummy that my dinner guests goobled it up.

Only one change. I was a little short of vanilla, so I used about 1/2 teaspoon of lemon extract. Doubt anyone would notice the difference. 

However, I have two questions: 1) my cake was a little difficult to get out of the pan. The recipe said to "grease the pan", which I did, but should I also have used flour? 2) I waited until the cake came out of the over to make the glaze, so it was still pretty warm and ran more than I expected. Should I have made it while the cake was baking to give it more time to cool before drizzling over the warm cake?

Made this delicious cake for family and friends. Easy recipe, and we all loved it. Will be making another one for our family Thanksgiving dinner. Thanks so much Dani Banani! It will be a tradition in my family too.

One of the most incredible apple bundt cakes I've ever made. All I can say, blown away. Now if I only can get my fiance to stop having it for dessert and breakfast I will get it to last longer than 24 hours. It has fall and early Christmas written all over it!
Easy to make and comes out super moist
It was delicious but didn’t need 1 hour and 20 minutes in the oven. I baked it for 1 hour and 10 minutes and it was a bit overdone. This recipe is a keeper.

I don't know if the baking directions are correct because an hour 20 was way too long! the cake was so dry that it had a crust on the top, and was stuck to the pan. I had to scoop it out with a spoon and then drizzle the caramel sauce over it in a pan. I don't know how it was, because I gave it away. I would give it another try, but would not bake so long, and would grease AND flour the pan!

This is the same recipe I've used for years from my Grandmother. It was always my favorite cake as a child. I use Granny Smith Apples, and Pecans instead of Walnuts & the Glaze is meant to be poured over a hot cake, just as it comes out of the oven. I cover the Bundt pan with foil after pouring over the Glaze, and leave it to sink deep into the cake- overnight. The cake always slides out easily. It's Always Delicious and a hit wherever you serve it!

I made this with the recommended changes of 1C brown sugar, 1 tsp cinnamon and 1/2 cup apple sauce. Also decreased the time to 70 minutes which was spot on, if not slightly overcooked. 

The cake has a nice texture, maybe it could have used more apple, or maybe I chopped them too finely. 

As per other recommendation I placed the cake plate under the rack so it caught the extra glaze so there is glaze on the bottom as well as the top.

Awesome recipe. I dont have a bundt pan, because I actually am not known to be the best baker, lol. But this was a pretty easy recipe to follow and I put the mixture into a two 8" cake pans. Surprisingly, it came out perfectly:). I got so many compliments, that I'm looking for something else to try baking. The icing was my actual favorite. Now I know how to make it! thanks so much for sharing. As far as all the people complaining about the oil or using applesauce, good onya, but its not necessary. We don't eat tons of desserts at my house, so that's not an issue for my family. This is a treat. I wouldn't try a recipe with substitutes and then review it, lol. Either make it as written or submit your own recipe. When you change the recipe, you arent rating the recipe, your submitting yours. Just do that to start with.
We Just added alot more cinnamon and sugar. So Gooooooood!

This cake is awesome. I used 1 c sugar, 1 c splenda and glaze was with brown sugar splenda. Other than these changes I made exactly as written. I let the glaze cool for about 10 minutes and it was a perfect glaze on the cake. So delicious!!

Love making this cake to celebrate fall! Like others I used 1/2 cup applesauce in place of some of the oil and used half brown sugar and half white sugar. My bundt pan is very dark, so I ended up cooking mine 90 minutes at 325. Also, I let the cake cool completely, and let the glaze cool off a bit before spooning on top. That kept more on the cake and less on the plate. And a sprinkle of chopped walnuts makes it pretty. Delicious!!

Love making this cake to celebrate fall! Like others I used 1/2 cup applesauce in place of some of the oil and used half brown sugar and half white sugar. My bundt pan is very dark, so I ended up cooking mine 90 minutes at 325. Also, I let the cake cool completely, and let the glaze cool off a bit before spooning on top. That kept more on the cake and less on the plate. And a sprinkle of chopped walnuts makes it pretty. Delicious!!

This cake is definitely a winner! Like many other reviewers, I too made some improvisational changes that just sounded right to me: 325 degrees for 70 mins was perfect; used 1/2 cup of walnuts; substituted 1 1/2 cups of veg. oil for 1 cup of walnut oil and 1/2 cup of fat free greek yogurt, used about 3 1/2 - 4 Honey Crisp apples, doubled the cinnamon, added vanilla to the glaze but only applied 3/4 of the amount to the cake and used 50% white sugar/50% light brown sugar. Then did a light dusting of confectioners sugar on top for contrast. Oh yeah...and add a little rum to that caramel glaze! (if you just want to add an added flavor dimension, add rum while cooking as it will cook out the alcohol. If you want the little extra “kick” from the rum, add rum (to taste) after cooking and just prior to drizzling over cake. :-)
This cake is amazing and I always get tons of compliments whenever I make it. My husband especially likes it and requests it often!

It was alright. I took the advice of others and use 1/2 cup applesauce and 1 cup oil, and I doubled the cinnamon. Still lacked much flavor. Even the glaze was somewhat bland and didn't bring the richness of flavor I was hoping for.

Made it twice - first time didn't chop apples small enough and it fell apart - tasted great just not pretty. Second time chopped both the apples and the nuts in my chopper - BEAUTIFUL and tasted super! So much fun to watch friends enjoying it with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

Definitely a keeper. I never made any changes. This cake stayed deliciously moist for nearly 2 weeks. I must admit cake does not normally last this long in my house usually a few days, but I forgot that my sons were going away for a week.
I use , Gluten-Free All Purpose Baking Flour

Love this cake. I did make a few changes. Used sugar in the raw instead of regular sugar, decreased walnuts to 1/2 cup and added 1/2 cup of craisens. I also added 1 tbs rum to the glaze. This is now my most requested dessert.
It was a good cake but I didn't feel it was anything exceptional. I probably won't make it again as there are so many recipes out there to try.

Loved this cake !
I did as others suggested and increased the cinnamon and added a pinch of nutmeg
I also needed to make a second batch of glaze as one wasn’t enough 
Thanks for the recipe, it’s a keeper

I made this to bring to a Thanksgiving gathering, and everyone loved it! Took a chance, as I never made it before! I followed some of the recommendations by the top reviewer. For the oil: used 1/2 cup of apple sauce and 1 cup of oil. Half white and half brown sugar. Used 1 tsp cinnamon. Baked at 325degF for 70 min. (It's been a while since I made this, but I believe that I took it out sooner.) I left out the walnuts since I some people don't want them. A reviewer suggested just topping the glaze with some, which is a good idea. Dani, thanks for the great recipe! UPDATE 11/28/19: At 325degF, this tested done a lot sooner, 55 min.

The family that was supposed to bring the apple pie for Thanksgiving couldn't make it so I saw this recipe and tried it. Everyone, and I mean everyone, LOVED it. I baked it the night before and made the glaze right before serving.
My changes per other reviews: applesauce in place of 1/2 cup of oil, 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup light brown, 1 tsp. cinnamon, toasted pecans (have a no-walnut eater), baked at 325 for 70 minutes and used dark brown sugar for glaze that I let sit for a bit before drizzling on. I did have a little trouble getting it out of the pan but I had only greased it; next time I will flour it too.
I will be making for Christmas along with a gingerbread cake.
Devoured by family!! Totally making again
I doubled the cinnamon, and used roasted pecans instead. It was delicious.

I substituted 1 cup brown sugar for 1 cup of the white sugar and I used 1/2 cup vegetable oil + 1/2 cup melted butter (everything's better with butter) and 1/2 cup applesauce for the 1-1/2 cups oil. I also increased the cinnamon to a full teaspoon. 
Made this for our It's 4 U Mom meeting at our church and everyone asked for the recipe.

This an absolutely wonderful cake! I made both a bundt and a two tier round cake to see which came out better. The tiered cake I prefer because I added the caramel topping in between the layers and therefore it was more moist and more flavorful. The bundt is a great coffee cake option because it is less sweet as the topping is light and most of the cake you will not be getting carmel with. I cooked the round cake for about 28 minutes. My husband took the tiered cake to a work function and it won out of almost 100 options. We didn't even know about the contest! It's a winner for sure! Enjoy!
Used pecans as that’s what I had on had - so delicious and will definitely make it again!
Super easy and very delicious. I cooked the caramel drizzle a little too long (more like candy than glaze), but will adjust next time. Thinking about trying it as muffins, too.
Great recipe. I didn't change a thing .It turned out perfect.

I made this for a Supper Club that we belong to. I took the advice of several previous reviewers and substituted 1/2 c applesauce for 1/2 c of the oil. The cake was great, and received rave reviews. Thanks for the recipe which is going into my file for future use.
Wonderful cake! I made this cake exactly as recipe stated and it was so good. I highly recommend it.

Absolutely delicious! My husband loved it. The only thing I did differently was to use about 3 cups of apples only because that is what I had thawed out. The caramel sauce was so easy to make and tasted wonderful.
Outstanding!!!

It fell out of pan out on the dish in a big blob. I cut the oil down and cooked 70 minutes as recommended. It tasted pretty good. I formed it into a volcano shape and put sauce on top. I called it an Apple Mountain cake. Not enough sauce to cover it. I’m not trying this one again.
I substituted the two apples for a quart jar of my own canned apples, draining most of the liquid. My families new favorite cake!
Amazing my family and coworkers loved it
I used pecans instead of walnuts...and one more Granny Smith apple then recipe calls for...am bringing to work tomorrow....will give update

What did I do wrong? Used the exact recipe - no changes nor substitutions. It smelled heavenly! It came out of the oven beautifully, but it wouldn’t come out of the bundt pan without a lot of coaxing. I Pam’d the pan - should I have “greased the pan” with shortening or something else? Thoughts?
Nice and moist and excellent taste.
Nice and moist and excellent taste.
This is THE absolute BEST cake I have ever made!!!
Easy and tasty! I substitute apple cider for the milk in the glaze. Everyone loved it

This is a great recipe for a gathering of 8-15 people. The cake looks beautiful, much like the picture. Many people said they liked it, but I noticed not everyone was able to finish a slice. It is very rich so cut slim pieces so you don't throw much away. The cake is better served warm so stick it in the microwave one slice at a time for 20 seconds.
Excellent cake! I made it twice in one week! The only change I made was adding more cinnamon. I used 1 1/2 tsps.
First time ever making it, it was very easy, and my family loved it, kudos to you, thank you

This cake was a real hit with the family. My only challenge was the length of time I cooked it because I used a springform pan as I didn't have a bundt pan. My oven is hard to gauge as it tends to overcook things. Will have to try it again using the bundt pan and adjusting the time for my oven.
My family love this cake (it's a good thing, I would have eaten it all myself!) Unfortunately I can't eat nuts so I didn't put them in, but it was still delicious. I'll be making it again soon.

This recipe is wonderful! I made it for a big group of people from church at our home last night, and they were raving about it, especially the guys and one of them asked for the recipe. I followed a couple of suggestions from others and it turned out perfectly: baked at 325 for 70 minutes, used 1 C white and 1 C brown sugar instead of all white, boiled the glaze for a little over a minute and let it cool/thicken for a few minutes before pouring over the cake. Also, I did use the full amount of oil and it was not oily at all, but had the perfect consistency.
This will be one of my favorite recipes for desserts and I'll be making it often.
I only used one cup of oil and it was still plenty moist. It was too sweet for my taste, but it made a pretty presentation.
This is a keeper. My family, even those who aren't fond of cake, loved it.

item.name: Apple Harvest Pound Cake with Caramel Glaze
